citation.article-title: Citreimonas salinaria gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the Roseobacter clade isolated from a solar saltern.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Citreimonas (Cit.re.i.mo′nas. L. n. citreum lemon; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Citreimonas a lemon-shaped monad).
The predominant fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c and 19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
Cells do not contain bacteriochlorophyll a and do not oxidize thiosulfate.
The genus is a member of the family Rhodobacteraceae.
The type species is Citreimonas salinaria.
